7D223FFA6CD748F49348D43F1857DC5C.description: Use and understand the grammatical terminology in Appendix 2 accurately and appropriately in discussing their writing and reading.

9BF7A21AC25A46D9B9C9531F69699A74.description: using a colon to introduce a list

5C94B787242A4C42A2873BA76A431226.description: using semicolons, colons or dashes to mark boundaries between independent clauses

498FB0F60E8C4F4D8E205AA25688A830.description: using brackets, dashes or commas to indicate parenthesis

4D6FEBD107684E5BA3A0792AA145134E.description: using commas to clarify meaning or avoid ambiguity in writing

FFBC1DE3C4DA4D53AC76F85DCEC96A42.description: indicate grammatical and other features by

12C661A790674F63BABE2DACD6A474B0.description: learning the grammar for years 5 and 6 in Appendix 2

448C6C6824454B109D8987884B16F9DD.description: using relative clauses beginning with who, which, where, when, whose, that or with an implied (ie omitted) relative pronoun

BA4B099EA5F34D1F8FF9A6D98F7E7FA2.description: using modal verbs or adverbs to indicate degrees of possibility

8CF99D25D2984EB9ACDB864B361F74F1.description: using expanded noun phrases to convey complicated information concisely

5234049133EC4124AB7EA984305A1F2D.description: using the perfect form of verbs to mark relationships of time and cause

D77263C30C3B4A99B60A5D5E04312442.description: using passive verbs to affect the presentation of information in a sentence

B2C07C1BB50C4DA19E3B32BA4A53E0FF.description: recognising vocabulary and structures that are appropriate for formal speech and writing, including subjunctive forms

616521DD0D734ED888E1FB9298C70E60.description: develop their understanding of the concepts set out in Appendix 2 by:

2EB191215A5C4BBD9DFC305CDDB14EBA.description: perform their own compositions, using appropriate intonation, volume, and movement so that meaning is clear.

4485CB56174546CDAB1D2C3825FDE8E2.description: proofread for spelling and punctuation errors

B612C966F88F4F6F8C9871532A7695F5.description: ensuring correct subject and verb agreement when using singular and plural, distinguishing between the language of speech and writing and choosing the appropriate register

89F09476D93E4037A721FBA647292964.description: ensuring the consistent and correct use of tense throughout a piece of writing

DEC50B38A241451DBDF51BEFF461C138.description: proposing changes to vocabulary, grammar and punctuation to enhance effects and clarify meaning

06E6085DFC8F4D95B1D89F53E601B05E.description: assessing the effectiveness of their own and others’ writing

8A854AFBE1304EAA82537330B660E53F.description: using further organisational and presentational devices to structure text and to guide the reader

6E1C42A8CD094ED59E196023435BAC17.description: using a wide range of devices to build cohesion within and across paragraphs

341BF1EE353F4C8BBE7D38CECB44BFA6.description: in narratives, describing settings, characters and atmosphere and integrating dialogue to convey character and advance the action

2940941CF88B476B96CE5F94EA0F7E1A.description: selecting appropriate grammar and vocabulary, understanding how such choices can change and enhance meaning

7ED74EAE624642909F813465B2D65D17.description: in writing narratives, considering how authors have developed characters and settings in what pupils have read, listened to or seen performed

9CA1497829B74F7BA7E99B2B36FA9521.description: noting and developing initial ideas, drawing on reading and research where necessary

890E689839B24CBA9E2B875AEABF3675.description: identifying the audience for and purpose of the writing, selecting the appropriate form and using other similar writing as models for their own

7263C5F9370344A4A6E992E728B711D6.description: Plan their writing by:   in writing narratives, considering how authors have developed characters and settings in what pupils have read, listened to or seen performed

3F8373B70B17476C8BF470C249FE1452.description: choosing the writing implement that is best suited for a task

08D3A982ECF2476CB7721A628E7ACC95.description: choosing which shape of a letter to use when given choices and deciding whether or not to join specific letters

74CC5B17655E444E95D132E5790CAA69.description:
Handwriting and Presentation
Pupils should be taught to write legibly , fluently and with increasing speed by:

CBB2D72131A249ECAB2843A8A92BA7B9.description: use the first 3 or 4 letters of a word to check spelling, meaning or both of these in a dictionary

28707659F9834126ABB0492B746EF19E.description: use dictionaries to check the spelling and meaning of words

36D0E44A15924266A68D9527A5B5FAA1.description: use knowledge of morphology and etymology in spelling and understand that the spelling of some words needs to be learnt specifically, as listed in Appendix 1

632E7B25631F405B9554B955431DC082.description: continue to distinguish between homophones and other words which are often confused

2D964958572F4801B74B069721D6D80B.description: use further prefixes and suffixes and understand the guidance for adding them

3C406F1408304557AA8ABA4AFACCE59A.description: provide reasoned justifications for their views.

9DF5CFBF21D4489DBED430A5294ADDFA.description: explain and discuss their understanding of what they have read, including through formal presentations and debates, maintaining a focus on the topic and using notes where necessary

AC4C5E10DE46404EB57C6747882619CD.description: participate in discussions about books that are read to them and those they can read for themselves, building on their own and others’ ideas and challenging views courteously

FA8789C4B9DF4B179A1459EDFF113824.description: retrieve, record and present information from non-fiction

3CEB8CD35AA9402783A7F719866ECCE7.description: distinguish between statements of fact and opinion

6B6CCC2B827E451E935EF1C15E82CB3C.description: discuss and evaluate how authors use language, including figurative language, considering the impact on the reader

1FC5357430944CCF931C2D0C7B52D077.description: identifying how language, structure and presentation contribute to meaning

19A5BC010A564F9693B61FAC118239B7.description: summarising the main ideas drawn from more than 1 paragraph, identifying key details that support the main ideas

6975F82324DF4974854C8C95A9022091.description: predicting what might happen from details stated and implied

7ED0211886F3457A90F8C18FB1B34382.description: drawing inferences such as inferring characters' feelings, thoughts and motives from their actions, and justifying inferences with evidence

CE1F0A6A362F45758B4138B766002B13.description: asking questions to improve their understanding

E157FC411775445DB2D5C16B02654A46.description: checking that the book makes sense to them, discussing their understanding and exploring the meaning of words in context  identifying how language, structure and presentation contribute to meaning

77D6067B872D4E168B54C196A67A947B.description: preparing poems and plays to read aloud and to perform, showing understanding through intonation, tone and volume so that the meaning is clear to an audience

02E7228FC47B4C00BC872374714FBD35.description: learning a wider range of poetry by heart

B0400973869E406486A0F28C1214D310.description: making comparisons within and across books

FF5F0100A6394F43965D9415A8DDAC60.description: identifying and discussing themes and conventions in and across a wide range of writing

41B0B5E88D654CF395FA1C8A706BC27C.description: recommending books that they have read to their peers, giving reasons for their choices

5C2A95F9C7564591BF1900CE3C548964.description: increasing their familiarity with a wide range of books, including myths, legends and traditional stories, modern fiction, fiction from our literary heritage, and books from other cultures and traditions

B66512D17A494AE3A2B9FE5E23BE2406.description: reading books that are structured in different ways and reading for a range of purposes

EC19CB6E33D848BF9D82D12562C5E900.description: continuing to read and discuss an increasingly wide range of fiction, poetry, plays, non-fiction and reference books or textbooks   preparing poems and plays to read aloud and to perform, showing understanding through intonation, tone and volume so that the meaning is clear to an audience

B299B11DAA5E4286A861868315EA90C9.description: maintain positive attitudes to reading and an understanding of what they read by:

87C4EFA566E0420BA05E689DE28404A5.description: a apply their growing knowledge of root words, prefixes and suffixes (morphology and etymology), as listed in English Appendix 1, both to read aloud and to understand the meaning of new words that they meet.

29FAAC70EB824662A15D84F7CD159809.description: Reading (The objectives for Reading are common across Years 5 and 6)

FDA29817AE73470A955D3156EF239708.description: select and use appropriate registers for effective communication

5E804DAAE9754813A5822BCF8E616863.description: consider and evaluate different viewpoints, attending to and building on the contributions of others

5CA5DCB2A7C8478DAFD3527FEC0464CB.description: gain, maintain and monitor the interest of the listener(s)

9720483BFDE94C75B40F8C692CF0B832.description: participate in discussions, presentations, performances, roleplay/improvisations and debates

66604D268FBF481F9AC8772FDFD4B55F.description: speak audibly and fluently with an increasing command of Standard English

009A974D5D6C41B8A79AD14A7E082AA0.description: use spoken language to develop understanding through speculating, hypothesising, imagining and exploring ideas

F60AEB7FAFC34A35BE18FB730755F73E.description: maintain attention and participate actively in collaborative conversations, staying on topic and initiating and responding to comments

E677251D92C44331B6DE4F4648240E48.description: give well-structured descriptions, explanations and narratives for different purposes, including for expressing feelings.

B8AEADAC84AC4B1BA8FE94A2B92F4460.description: articulate and justify answers, arguments and opinions

80350DA6DC494C0CB94353080059E0B8.description: use relevant strategies to build their vocabulary

C9172C3046AC445FBE766408DB530048.description: ask relevant questions to extend their understanding and knowledge

59C3169C2BE64DCEB103998F77238432.description: listen and respond appropriately to adults and their peers

Spoken Language
(The objectives for Spoken Language are common across Key Stages 1 and 2)
